solving problems that involve live data over IRC is difficult and risky. If you have a local Linux User Group nearby, I'd suggest contacting them, there's going to be at least one helpful person who will handle this for a beer and a "thanks" without much effort, or at least confirm that the problem requires professional data recovery services
that might be a very stupid question, but is the testdisk version you have the correct one? Linux, architecture (32bit or 64bit) matching the system you have installed.
wols asked the right question - was it installed using apt? It should be available there
nah, that's not the right way. Discard whatever you might have installed and run sudo apt-get install testdisk
if it still doesn't work, then we have a problem
those read errors for sdc are the disk you're trying to read data from?
that's the point where I usually unplug the thing and estimate wether the data stored on it is worth the $500 and up it costs to recover it
trying to do anything with a disk that has hardware problems is a bad idea. VERY bad idea. No, I'm not employed by a data recovery company.
